newsitem.title: GHANA: Ghana bourse slips in slow first session of year.
newsitem.headline: Ghana bourse slips in slow first session of year.

text.p: The Ghana Stock Exchange slipped back in its first session of 1997 in slow trading on Thursday. Traders blamed the post holiday lull for the easing.
The GSE All-Share-Index fell 0.62 points to 360.14 points after falling 1.19 points on Monday, its last 1996 session.
Offers totalled 1,238,410 against bids of 552,410 with 532,010 shares changing hands, up on Monday's 28,910.
Unilever (-20 cedis to 780 cedis), Social Security Bank (+3 to 1,060) and Pioneer Tobacco Company (+2 to 135) were the only movers.
